column4: Timeless and ageless styles are the main reason I shop for the luxury fashion brands. For example I feel always so proud and happy to carry my 20+years handbags from Hermès ( Kelly 35 sellier to be specific). Hermès also releases some new styles of handbags but they usually variate in sizes ( minis are very hot now). I used to love Louis Vuitton but as they explore too many styles in printing ( monogram with some designs) I began to avoid such items as I feel carrying them is outdated.

column4: When I was a little girl I used to imagine myself walking down Fifth Avenue and looking into the windows at Tiffany’s and Saks Fifth Avenue. I dreamt of one day being able to wear what I saw in the windows. Today I am still that little girl but I am now wearing the things I used to imagine.  What differentiates designer clothing from other fashion brands is how it makes you feel when you put it on or carry, the workmanship that is behind what you are putting on or carrying, and the fabric/materials used by the designers. Saying that what is luxury to one is not luxury to another. It is a personal preference – for me it is always being that little girl imagining what could be when looking into  the windows at Tiffany’s and Saks Fifth Avenue.
Luxury brands are timeless and classic and can have an edge all at the same time. It makes you personally feel good wearing a designer brand
The luxury designer clothing,shoes,bags quality is for lifetime and always look classy and in style

IMO the 3 major fashion conglomerates that produce 90% of the Luxury market share factories. They buy product product in China and assemble in Italy therefor being able to say the item was made in Italy. Kering, LVMH, Richemont.

Hermes and Chanel are still independent which shows in its quality and value retention.

When I buy a Birkin it’s going to keep, if not double or triple in value. When I buy a YSL Tote I’m losing my money and the item will soon be out of style.

Same with Chanel Classics. The price may be INSANE but the item will last for years and so will the style. I cannot say the same for Chloe, Givenchy, Gucci or Dolce and Gabbana Bags.

The attention to detail, the superior craftsmanship, the higher quality and uniqueness of the materials, be it fabrics, leathers or metals, the originality of the designs, the limited supply.

A luxury brand will offer a consumer a unique and impeccable shopping experience.  Being able to build relationships with my SA’s throughout the different luxury brands that I shop at is something I don’t get with other brands
Designer brands are statement piece. They give me confidence, and tell the world, “I’ve made it”. The quality is unmatched and I consider all my luxury brands an investment.

I believe you get what you pay for! Though luxury brands are not for everyone, I admire the exemplary craftsmanship and style they afford me. I prefer to spend more on a timeless, classic item that will transcend seasons than buy trend. Additionally, luxury brand are easily identified. When I choose an additional piece for my collection, it’s almost like an adrenaline rush!
Opinion

column4: I think luxury brands are more about catering to classic and timeless designs. You can wear these brands anytime and almost anywhere and their easily recognizable and makes your whole outfit chic! I also love the fact that luxury items now hold much of their value particularly bags like chanel or Hermes. Some are even considered investment pieces . I also love VIP treatment of SA’s and the houses themselves to clients like us. We are often made to feel special and important whenever we shop, answering all our questions and being patient with us, especially during the pandemic when going to the store was not possible. Talking or texting my SA helped a lot! Luxury brands also know how to zhush up their Classic collections based on trends with limited-editions and collabs! It makes you covet more from a particular house all the time!
The details make the difference to me. Soft satin lining a jacket, a zipper that moves smoothly, stitching that doesn’t come loose.....
Quality, exclusivity, style
A luxury brand has good quality materials, good fit, identifiable brand style or logo, proper packaging/presentation and excellent service that presents a memorable boutique experience.
What differentiates luxury fast brands from other fashion brands is 1) the style, which I find to be more distinctive/unique, and 2) the craftsmanship, which i find to be more detailed & intricate.

Gucci tote
Luxury fashion brands are timeless, high quality, and send a statement about my personality. More specifically, a wardrobe defines you, what you tolerate, what you love, and how you think about yourself.

Luxury brand usually has more details. Also seasonal designs which are unique. Chanel has their fantasy tweed which is a really beautiful handwork piece. Dior likes their feminine soluette with the waist altered smaller and Dior’s knit work and crochet handwork are gorgeous.
Chanel and Hermès handbags last a long time! The stitching is tight and don’t come lose. Leather doesn’t peel.
Craftsmanship and exclusivity
Statement pieces that will be around for a long time, quality
I always feel special when wearing a designer piece, more confident. I like to treat myself to pieces that make me feel good and that I look forward to wearing!

column4: Quality of material, design, history, scarcity
Creativity, Design, Attention to detail and marketing, these differentiates the brands from one another and make them more desirable.
Luxury brands are exclusive. They have impeccable craftsmanship. It's a high level, or should be a high level experience when you purchase in the brand's boutiques. Service is very personalized.

I have a distinct taste and one that is not easily replicated.
I like having a style that reflects my personal lifestyle, and also having items coveted by others.
Luxury items are life long items. I have started my collection of designer items since my 20s and I still wear items that are 30+ years old. Old styles always come back! I love my luxury items!

I think the quality of many of the designer items I have is better than some of my other garments. The expensive pieces that I buy look good for years. I only buy classic pieces so my things are timeless. I still where a chanel bag that I got 30 years ago. I treat my designer things well and I'm very careful with them. I also buy these things because I admit to liking the status and wearing these things makes me feel a bit more special and can give me a lift.
The quality , the craftsmanship of the product

The quality of designer brands vs non-designer brands is what separates designer pieces from the rest. You can see the quality in the stitching and materials that are used to make designer pieces. Designer clothing have a more tailored fit than clothing pieces that are not of a designer brand. I also love the fact that certain designer pieces are timeless and actually appreciate in value over time. You can have designer bags that last year after year and never goes out of style.
Quality and investment. I like the way things look
It's the quality and craftsmanship. It's exclusivity. To me, luxury doesn't mean that everyone can get it. It's also great service.

I view certain designer brands as timeless and an “asset” for my wardrobe. I think about how I want to wear each piece for 5-10 years, and how good I feel wearing it even if the cost per wear is high. Other fashion brands come and go for me, and I don’t expect to wear them for more than a season or two. In the last 5 years, I have tried really hard not to buy other brands and only use it to fill a void which designer brands don’t have such as a plain white T or denim or a passing trend.

There is a reason why there is a cache attached to Luxury fashion--it's fit, quality and structure I find to be far superior. Also these brands retain their value. Almost like a commodity on the stock exchange. That is the selling point I should tell my husband 🤣. I also love that when you purchase a luxury clothing item not everyone is wearing it--I like to have my own kind of style and enjoy wearing pieces that are not as easy to come by. Designers aren't mass producing these items. And they are made more personally. Stitching by hand, almost like it's made just for me. If that makes sense.

The unique touches such as the type and placement of hardware or a design/pattern indicating within which season it was purchased. Also the timeless of Chanel, the versatility of Louis Vuitton & the trendiness of Gucci. Each luxury brand has a touch that differentiates it from another brand.

In my opinion, what differentiates a luxury fashion brand are the quality material and craftsmanship. Also just as important, the shopping experience from the interaction and training of store associates, follow up and aftermarket sales when necessary, and the overall experience with the brand.
For me these purchases are an investment, great quality than of the less expensive brands the craftsmanship, the fit.

Materials used for hardware.

Something about the luxury item should not be replicable. 

The brand and it's products must be Top of class and deliver some meaningful or measurable value like Innovation, Exclusivity, Heritage, Relevance.

column4: The boutique experience and the overall quality! LV’s material lasts for decades and so does Gucci’s canvas. Once protected the Louboutin’s become a staple when paired with a less expensive dress or jeans.

For me, a luxury fashion brand Is differentiated from other brands by the history, Such as Hermes Kelly or Birkin bag, Or Chanel.. Those fadhion brands have Been around forever, They area classic And not trendy..

I think a luxury brand is different from other brands for several reasons. First being exclusivity: it’s harder to attain and it’s typically at a higher price point that not all can attain. Second being quality:
The quality is typically higher than everyday to mid price brands.

Third being service: there is an expectation of a higher level of service from luxury brands than everyday brands.
Quality of products. "Limited" - do not want to spend $$$ if everyone can buy.

Exclusivity - the item I buy won't be easy to find or for others to find. Quality - the construction will be the finest and made to last a long time. Taste - the item will be one that will be in good taste even if it is avant garde or not yet in fashion. Uniqueness - the item will reflect a certain style or aesthetic that the particular brand is known for and will be in character with the identity of the brand. Splurge - the item will be more expensive than other items and will add a feeling of luxe that will elevate any outfit. Overall brand identity - the brand will carefully curate its messaging so that I will feel proud to be associated with the brand and those that wear it.
Inventiveness - the brand will seek to explore new ideas and styles, and to set the trends years in advance, and will not be content to simply follow the mainstream. Design - the item will be designed to feature thoughtful details and features that are unique and will be useful to or delight the wearer. Experience - the experience of purchasing the item will be a pleasure from start to finish, from stepping into the store, whether to browse or ultimately purchase. There is a feeling that the brand seeks to build a lasting relationship to which the buyer wants to return again and again, not a short term sales transaction.

Luxury brands focus on the total elevated experience for the customers. The store, ambiance, the staff, every detail that includes elevated shopping bags and gift wrap. column4: The differentiating qualities of a luxury fashion brand includes source materials, design, quality of construction, service delivery and client relationship building. Luxury fashion sources the best materials to create the product. These materials have a more pleasing feel and look, longevity and wear better than non-luxury brands. The design aspects of luxury stems from the creative minds at the helm of the various fashion brands. Luxury fashion creates the look while non-luxury follows the look. Quality of construction and fit sets apart luxury fashion from the rest. Luxury items are made with care and it shows from the pattern, fit and finish...just doesn't compare. Finally, service delivery and relationship building is at the core of luxury. The presentation of the final product and treatment of clientele creates an experience. Luxury shopping should be an experience of enjoyment and echo the brands' overall image and be relatable to the client.
Quality of the product

column4: For me a luxury brand means superb quality, exquisite craftsmanship, items that stand the test of time and something I will be able to use and enjoy for a long time. Luxury brands like Hermès prides itself with only giving the highest quality products, most of them handmade by an artisan, guaranteeing the best of the best. Luxury brands tend to stand the test of time, retaining its value over time (or in the case of Chanel and Hermes classics, value increases in time). It also means exclusivity and tend to have a smaller but more discerning following. Luxury brand aficionados love the heritage/history of each house and appreciate all the hard work that goes into it. Other fashion brands on the other hand are like fast fashion, they cater to trends, what sells now. The quality is not that great, most are mass produced,  and very accessible to everyone. Fashion brands tend to cater to seasonality anf trends, something you can enjoy for months or a few years (depending on the quality). For fashion brands, the heritage/history does not matter as much.

column4: For me the key components that distinguish a luxury brand are (1) quality of craftsmanship, (2) an evolved, unique design aesthetic, (3) rarity/exclusiveness of items, and (4) incredible service both during and after purchase. Those things likely translate into higher priced items but high prices without underlying value isn't luxury.
Quality of the materials and the construction. I like the idea of “investment” pieces.

I would say unfortunately the label. It’s a status symbol for our income level. Clearly myself and others at our income level tend to shop in stores such as Bergdorf’s and Saks where you can only purchase luxury labels. The high quality, craftsmanship and uncompromised style. There’s nothing like the feeling you get from buying a luxury piece and every time you wear it - so much joy.

The most important quality that differentiates a fashion brand is the overall feel of the brand. What style or image are they trying to portray through the combined collection of bags, clothes, shoes, etc? That’s an important question. I also think having an original and unique style also is important. For example, I’ve seen a few brands copy Hermès Kelly or Chanel classic flap and it makes me feel like this brand that copies others hasn’t really matured yet. Finally, I consider investment value. I’m always updating my closet and my style has changed from my 20s to early 30s. I never buy with the intention to sell, but I am conscious that my style might be in the middle of changing so I keep abreast of how easily the bag sells and whether or not it can hold its value.

column4: The brand strategy for luxury brands is different than other fashion brands. Luxury doesn’t meet a need or solve a problem, and so it is intrinsically wrong to position a luxury brand based on how it compares to its competitors. Luxury consumers aren’t interested in more features giving better value for money – that’s a premium marketing angle. Luxury consumers want to know about a brand’s heritage, prestige and uniqueness; it’s identity which counts, rather than a competitive edge.

column4: For me personally what differentiates a luxury fashion brand are several factors. First and foremost is quality, the durability of an item is dependent on the quality of the item. I always research the materials the item is made out of not only for my personal knowledge but also to know what I am buying, how to care for it, durability, and if I am getting ripped off. I like to make sure that the luxury item I am paying for is actually luxurious and not cheaply made with cheap materials. I also like to make sure that if I am spending a lot of money I want it to be on something that is timeless and can last for my daughters to one day inherit. Another thing that is important to me is customer service, how you are treated at the store and if they have good service. I also like the items to be exclusive and not something everyone can get their hands on. I also like to buy from brands that have a fair return policy in case I don’t end up liking the item. But the biggest thing after quality has to be customer service. It has happened that I go into a store wanting to buy an item but if I am not treated correctly and nicely by the sales associate I will not buy anything. It also is really frustrating to get a sales associate who doesn’t know much about the brand.
Luxury is not something that everyone can attain. A luxury fashion brand should be (or at least feel) exclusive.

Designer bags are truly timeless pieces that one can enjoy for the remainder of their life whereas a regular leather bag is bound to go out of style. Saving and spending a few hundred dollars more to buy a designer piece is truly worth every penny. The quality of designer items are almost always better than any regular item. The stitching, fabrics, leather are extremely unique and made to perfection. I love receiving endless compliments on the luxury items I buy, as it is so rewarding! I feel as if I can pass down my luxury bags, clothes, shoes, and accessories to many generations to come! Absolutely live by quality over quantity.

For clothing, being able to alter and have the SA help with fit is very helpful. For shoes and bags, there is nothing more important than your relationship with your SA. What differentiates luxury brands from other brands is the quality, design and for clothing also the fit. I find that more times than not you get what your pay for. With luxury brands some items also hold their value and are timeless.
Chicness of the runway shows
Fabric, metal color, hardware, quality overall and design

I really appreciate the high quality and care that is put into luxury fashion brands. Even the luxe packaging is something that stands out to me from other fashion brands. I also appreciate the value of luxury items and the legacy they leave behind for future generations.

column4: Quality of luxury brands are better. The history and craftsman’s ship are superior. The exclusivity of luxury is also important. It’s nice to have unique things that you don’t see everyone owning.
Quality is far superior, styles are timeless, part of capsule wardrobe, history of brand / certain styles are both interesting and show how they will continue to stand the test of time.

In my opinion I am positive that quality differentiates a luxury fashion brand from other fashion brands. Luxury brands create their products with the highest grade of material. I have had other lower end brands that have lasted 6 months while my more luxury items have lasted for years.
The material is the biggest difference. You can tell based on the stitching how well made something is everything luxury lasts longer

column4:
in my opinion the things that primarily differentiates luxury fashion brands are listed below:

*   The Exclusivity of the pieces. Typically a designer will create seasonal pieces ( designs, colors, etc) that they will retire at the end of the season. Therefore it creates a sense of urgency for you to buy and uniqueness.
    
*   QUALITY, QUALITY!! The high quality of luxury brands are worth the investment. It’s so comforting to know that your leathered items are made with premium quality and carefully stitched, which in turn would lasts for years for proper care.
Quality, stitching, exclusivity, reputation, social status
Quality and service, longevity of product
It’s the quality and heritage that goes into the products. Each piece is unique and constructed by master craftsman.

Luxury fashion brands hold value over time which make them a better investment pieces in oppose to “fast fashion” brands. Luxury fashion has higher quality materials- which make them more timeless than other fashion brands.
timeless. Quality. Perception. Attractiveness.

column3: discussed YSL and also got Gucci so here is Gucci black bag
column4: A luxury fashion brand piece stands out and makes an outfit. A luxury designer also has pieces that last you and the quality of the item lasts a lot longer than a typical item.

The experience of buying in a luxury store vs. buying from a store that has racks of the same item.

The quality of the items can last a lifetime
When you invest in a luxury item, its serves as a unique piece that celebrates your personal style. I keep all of my luxury items, forever.

Quality and exclusivity is what differentiates a luxury fashion brand from other fashion brands. Luxury brands are made from fine materials and hold up well over time. They are a true investment and hold their value. Luxury items are exclusive- not everyone can have them. They are prestigious and valuable.
For one, the price. Second, designer pieces are like collector's item and are usually timeless. The pieces usually retain their value and make you feel as if you belong to a special club

A luxury fashion brand is more exclusive than a regular fashion brand. Typically, these brands are setting the standards for current trends rather than following them. The quality of these products (such as that of the fabrics used) is much higher than those of a regular fashion brand, and said products are valued higher cost due to their uniqueness and creative design. Many of the styles implemented by luxury fashion brands are timeless and are fashionable throughout many generations due to their prestige.

I would define a luxury brand as a brand that makes products that are rare, unique, high quality and fashion forward. It’s expensive but doesn’t cost more than what it’s worth. They’re hard to find and access. A luxury brand should make you feel luxurious. They produce items you desire not items that you actually require. They make items you desire and will go to great lengths to find pieces you adore.
Quality of craftsmanship
